title: VLSI EDA Toolkit: A Python-Based Physical Design Automation Framework
description:
A comprehensive, from-scratch implementation of core EDA (Electronic Design Automation) algorithms for VLSI physical design. Built for research, education, and algorithmic exploration.

The toolkit implements the complete VLSI physical design flow:

  • Netlist Parsing — Multi-format benchmark reader (MCNC, YAL, JSON, Random Generation)
  • Floorplanning — Simulated Annealing + novel PIAB-FP (Physics-Inspired Agent-Based Floorplanner) where each cell is an autonomous agent subject to repulsive, attractive, boundary, thermal, and gravitational forces
  • Global Routing — A*-based congestion-aware pathfinding with rip-up-and-reroute
  • Static Timing Analysis — DAG-based forward/backward propagation, WNS/TNS, critical path tracing
  • Visualization — Publication-quality floorplan, thermal heatmap, congestion map, and convergence plots
notes: This software implements the PIAB-FP algorithm — a novel Physics-Inspired Agent-Based Floorplanner for thermal-aware VLSI macro-block placement, as described in the associated research paper.
